Name: The Brown Cow
Address: The Brown Cow, Ireland Bridge, Bingley, United Kingdom

Name: Cottingley Town Hall Church
Address: Cottingley Town Hall, Main Street, Cottingley, BINGLEY
Description: Cottingley Town Hall was built in 1865 as a community asset to provide a meeting place in the village.

Name: Martinez Bingley Wine Shop & Wine Bar
Five Rise Records
Description:
Based in Bingley town centre, Five Rise Records have been trading online since 2016, selling the latest current releases as well as quality 2nd hand vinyl. 

We are always looking to buy quality record collections, so get in touch if you are looking to sell. 

We occassionally have live music in the shop.
image-credit: Photo: Neil Horsley, Bingley Camera Club

Name: Myrtle Park
Description: Myrtle Park is in the heart of Bingley and as such is one of the most popular outdoor places in town. It's a huge park with a variety of native trees and wildlife and a large meadow nestled in one of the meanders of the River Aire.

Name: Bradford And Bingley Rugby Club
Description: Home to the Bingley Weekender festival and live music at various times throughout the year.

Name: All Saints Parish Church
Description: An ancient church which has served the congregation and people of Bingley for over a thousand years.

Name: The Potting Shed
Description: The original Potting Shed, planted in the pretty Market Town of Bingley

Name: The Peacock Bar Bingley
Description: Authentic Indian bar with real ale and Indian street food with a twist.

Name: The Fisherman's Pub
Description: The Fisherman's canal side pub and restaurant is situated on the Outskirts of Bingley on Wagon Lane.

Name: Cottingley Community Centre
Description: A purpose built community and corporate centre which houses offices and meeting rooms as well as a large event space with a bar and cafe.

Name: The Birches Eldwick
Description: In the heart of Eldwick, a new exciting village pub. Regular Live Music, Quiz nights and Food Vans!

Name: Amazing Finds
Address: First Floor, 110 Main Street Bingley West Yorkshire
Description: Vintage, Retro, Salvage Shop that sometimes also hosts music events.

Name: St Wilfrid Church
Description: One of two churches working together in Bingley: Holy Trinity Church, Trinity Place, Bingley & St Wilfrid Church, Gilstead Lane, Gilstead
